result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Michael White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-IMPOSED/STAYED.
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.


-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Random and regular testing, with weekly testing as a minimum.
-If employment is obtainable Defendant to be employed.
-Defendant to participate in AODA in St. Croix County Jail if Defedant completes program.
-Court orders Defendant to sign a release with DOC to allow sisters to have knowledge of the Substance Abuse Program and any other conditions.
-Court will release Defendant from condition time.

AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
Court recommended inpatient treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman DF: Steven Michael White appeared from jail. Case called at 11:11. 7 years total confinement 
3 years initial confinement
4 years ES
Court notes 163 days credit against any ultimate sentence. 

4 years probation imposed
- 5 months condition time.
- Costs of $268.00.
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00. 
- AODA and any recommended follow through. Court recommended inpatient treatment  
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Regular and regular testing, with weekly testing as a minimum. 
- If employment is obtainable DE to be employed. 
- DE to participate in AODA in St. Croix County Jail. If DE completes the program
  Court will release DE from condition time. 
- Court orders DE to sign a release with DOC to allow sisters to have knowledge of the substance abuse program and any other conditions. 

Court finds DE is eligible for the substance abuse program. 

Court revokes bail.
Court authorizes transfer of probation to MN.

Pre-trial conference on September 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

**BOND AMENDED**

Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Daniel B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
